data.weatherOverview: Isle Royale National Park is a remote archipelago in the middle of Lake Superior. To make the most of your visit, it is necessary that you plan ahead and prepare. Be aware that many services and items that are available on the mainland are not available at Isle Royale. Due to the unpredictable waters of Lake Superior and its effect on island weather, be prepared for any and all weather conditions.

accessibility.wheelchairAccess: No wheelchair access.
accessibility.fireStovePolicy: Camp fire rings are located at each individual tent site. Otherwise, self-contained stoves only.
accessibility.rvInfo: No RV/Trailer access.
accessibility.adaInfo: Uneven, rough terrain throughout campground. Facilities are not accessible.

data.name: Lizard Creek Campground
data.description: This rustic campground is in a remote part of Grand Teton National Park. The campground is 11 miles south of Yellowstone and eight miles north of Colter Bay Village providing easy access to both parks. The campsites are in a spruce and fir forest on the shores of Jackson Lake. One mile across the lake is the northern portion of the Teton Range including Webb Canyon, Owl and Ranger peaks. Looking south, the expanse of the Teton Range towers over Jackson Lake.
data.reservationInfo: Campsites are reservable on Recreation.gov. Plan ahead and reserve your site up to six months in advance.
data.regulationsOverview: Please follow all Grand Teton National Park regulations. A partial list may be found below. Other regulations apply. 1. Food storage - all food and other items with an odor must be properly stored at all times 2. Wildlife viewing - 100 yards minimum from bears and wolves, 25 yards from all others 3. Campfires - must be contained within a metal fire grate 4. Fireworks - banned at all times 5. Drones (unmanned aircraft) - banned at all times 6. Pets - must be on a leash <6 feet at all times within 30 feet of roadways; not allowed on the multi-use pathway, park trails or in the backcountry.

emailAddresses.description: https://www.signalmountainlodge.com/signal-mountain-camping/lizard-creek-campground

fees.description: Fee per night for campers with a vehicle. All campsites include a picnic table, fire pit, and nearby restrooms. Most sites have a bear box. Restrooms have flush toilets and cold running water. Shower facilities are available in the park, but not at the campground. *Rates do not reflect Senior and Access passholder discounts, taxes, or incremental charges.
fees.title: Campsite with vehicle

data.directionsOverview: Heading north from Jackson on US 26/89/191, turn left (west) at Moran Junction. Travel north on US 89/191/287, 18 miles to the Lizard Creek Campground sign, turn left (west) into the campground. Heading south from Yellowstone on US 89/191/287, continue 11 miles and turn right (west) at the Lizard Creek Campground sign continuing into the campground.

data.weatherOverview: Grand Teton National Park has long, cold winters—snow and frost are possible any month. April, May, & June - Mild days and cool nights alternate with rain and snow. July & August - Warm days and cool nights prevail, with afternoon thundershowers common. September, October, & November - Sunny days and cold nights alternate with rain and occasional snowstorms. December to April - Between storms the days are sunny and nights are frigid. Snow blankets the mountains and valley.

accessibility.wheelchairAccess: The campground loop roads are paved but on hilly terrain making wheelchair access challenging. Restroom facilities are partially accessible.
accessibility.internetInfo: No internet service. The closest public wireless internet access is at the Craig Thomas Discovery & Visitor Center in Moose.
accessibility.cellPhoneInfo: Cell phone service is not reliable in the northern part of Grand Teton National Park.
accessibility.fireStovePolicy: Campfires are allowed at designated campgrounds within metal fire grates unless fire restrictions are in effect. Downed and dead wood may be collected within the campground.
accessibility.rvInfo: RVs and trailers up to 30 feet in total length are allowed. There are no hookups, dump station or water fill station.
accessibility.adaInfo: The Lizard Creek Campground has two loops with 60 individual sites. At this time, none are ADA accessible. In the future, the campground will redesign sites to be compliant. Restroom facilities are partially accessible. No showers are available. No payphone is available. Route into the amphitheater is well-compacted gravel and on a slight slope.

data.name: Locust Grove Group Sites
data.description: The Locust Grove Group sites are located at the townsite of Old Kettle Falls, near Kettle Falls Campground and Kettle Falls Day Use Area. There are two sites with a capacity for 50 people and 75 people, respectively. A nature trail leads to Kettle Falls Campground and Kettle Falls Day Use Area with swim beach. Locust Grove Group sites are spacious and set apart from the hustle and bustle of the Kettle Falls Campground area.

passportStampImages.altText: A virtual passport stamp with an overview of the lake, with hills and trees surrounding it.
passportStampImages.title: Lake Roosevelt Virtual Visit 2022

data.reservationInfo: The Locust Grove group sites must be reserved year-round. Reservations must be made seven or more days in advance of your stay, and up to twelve months beforehand. Changes to your reservation cannot be made within seven days of your scheduled arrival. Reservations may have additional fees.
data.regulationsOverview: Maximum Stay: Camping is limited to 14 consecutive nights per campground within a 30 day period and not more than 60 total nights per calendar year anywhere within LRNRA. These limits apply to all camping activities within LRNRA. Check-Out Time: Noon Quiet Hours: From 10 pm to 6 am. This includes generators. Nighttime Closures: Campgrounds are closed to non-registered campers from 10 pm to 6am. Site Occupation: Site A allows 75 people and 35 vehicles maximum. Site B allows 50 people and 25 vehicles maximum. Property left unattended for 24 hours will be considered abandoned. Leave No Trace: The wheels of all vehicles and trailers must be within the designated parking space and not on the roadway or vegetation. Do not attach wires, ropes, or nails to trees or shrubs. Digging, leveling, or other alterations of the ground is not permitted.

fees.description: The fee for a group site with 1 – 25 occupants.
fees.title: Group Camping Fee, 1 – 25 People

fees.description: The fee for a group site with 26 to 50 occupants.
fees.title: Group Camping Fee, 26 – 50 People

fees.description: The fee for a group site with 51 to 75 occupants.
fees.title: Group Camping Fee, 51 – 75 People

data.directionsOverview: From Kettle Falls, drive north on US 395. Turn left onto WA 25 south. After about ½ mile, turn right onto Old Kettle Road. At the bottom of the hill (4-way intersection), turn left onto Kettle Park Road / S Riverside Avenue. Turn right at the Locust Grove Group Sites sign.

operatingHours.description: Locust Grove Group sites are open year-round, but water is not available in winter or times of low lake level. The group sites are closed for maintenance on Wednesdays.
operatingHours.name: Locust Grove Group Sites

images.title: Locust Grove 1
images.altText: A grassy area with picnic tables and a gazebo beyond.

images.title: Locust Grove 2

data.weatherOverview: Summer weather is hot and buggy, with highs averaging in the 90s and lows in the 50s. Rain and thunderstorms can happen any time of year. In the winter, expect cold temperatures and possible snow. Temperatures can vary in spring and fall. Be prepared for many types of weather in all seasons.

accessibility.wheelchairAccess: Much of the group sites are not wheelchair accessible. The campground access road is paved, but the entire camping area (such as picnic tables, parking spaces, and pit toilets) is unpaved and over uneven ground.
accessibility.cellPhoneInfo: Most major carriers have cell coverage at Locust Grove group sites. Check or report cell reception on Recreation.gov campground reviews: https://www.recreation.gov/camping/campgrounds/234066
accessibility.fireStovePolicy: Fires are permitted only in the designated fire rings, and only as long as there are no burn bans or dangerous fire weather.
accessibility.rvInfo: RVs and trailers may camp at Evans. The group sites can accommodate most RV lengths. Locust Grove does not have hookups.
accessibility.additionalInfo: The group sites have a few picnic tables and fire pits with grates. There is a nearby Day Use Area with covered picnic area and swim beach. The dump station, amphitheater, and camp hosts are located at nearby Kettle Falls Campground. Kettle Falls Campground also has a boat launch (1280’) with adjacent parking lot. Water is turned off during the winter and periods of extreme low water. Please check with us to be sure water is available.
accessibility.adaInfo: The campground access road is paved. The group site parking area is uneven ground. Campsite areas, like picnic tables and fire pits, are unpaved. The pit toilet is accessed over unpaved, uneven ground.
